intro: Coluria oligocarpa, commonly known as the narrowleaf coluria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and are accompanied by bracts that are often more prominent than the actual flowers. Coluria oligocarpa is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
